item.title: Rita of the West
item.description: Rita of the West, is a 1967 Italian musicarello-spaghetti western film directed by Ferdinando Baldi.

item.title: Preparati la bara!
item.description: Django, Prepare a Coffin, alternatively titled Viva Django, is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Ferdinando Baldi. The film stars Terence Hill in the title role, which was previously played by Franco Nero in Sergio Corbucci's original film. Django, Prepare a Coffin is unique among the plethora of films which capitalized on Corbucci's in that it is not only a semi-official, legitimate follow-up, but was also originally intended to star Nero.

item.title: Arizona Colt Returns
item.description: Arizona Colt Returns, also known as Arizona Lets Fly and Kill Everybody and If You Gotta Shoot Someone... Bang! Bang!, is a 1970 Italian-Spanish Spaghetti Western film directed by Sergio Martino and starring Anthony Steffen. The feature film debut of Martino after a series of documentary films, it is the sequel of Arizona Colt, with Steffen replacing Giuliano Gemma in the title role and with only Roberto Camardiel reprising his role from the previous film.

item.title: Ten Thousand Dollars for a Massacre
item.description: 10.000 dollari per un massacro is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Romolo Guerrieri.
